item.description:
We got a lot of votes in our recent poll for this show, and it looks pretty popular -- it's almost sold out! It should be amazing - it features music from Pink Floyd, Rolling Stones and the Grateful Dead. **This will be one of the last Meetups of the season, as I typically take a break over the summer and we start up again with the fall season.

More info here. Or read the New York Times review.

Meetup details: Tickets are $40 + outrageous handling fees (theatre, Amazon payments) = $47. When you RSVP, please pay online. If I can't get tickets, I will refund your money. Don't wait -- there are still seats left, but I'm sure they will sell out. The deadline to RSVP is 5 pm April 9. If you miss the deadline, but still want to go, send me an email.

The show starts at 8 pm, and we will meet in the lobby of the Sandra Feinstein Gamm Theatre at 7:15 p.m. There is limited parking on the left side of the theatre and on the streets around the back of the theatre.

After the show, we will head up the street to Doherty's East Avenue Irish Pub for food and drinks -- a fun local pub.

Summary:
You won’t want to miss the Rhode Island premiere of an extraordinary theatrical event from four-time Tony Award winner Tom Stoppard (Rosencrantz and Guildenstern Are Dead, Travesties, The Real Thing, The Coast of Utopia). It's August 1968, and Russian tanks are rolling into Prague. Jan, a recently repatriated Czech student, lives for rock music. Max, a Cambridge professor and dyed-in-the-wool Marxist, lives for Communism. By 1990, revolution has taken hold, the tanks are rolling out and idealism is nowhere to be found. All that remains is love...and loud music. A sweeping drama spanning two countries and 22 turbulent years—punctuated by the soul-stirring sounds of legendary groups like the Stones, Pink Floyd and the Grateful Dead—Rock ‘n’ Roll is a complex, moving and electrifying exploration of society in the throes of transformation.
item.name: Rock n Roll - Gamm
